verses.kjv: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God;
verses.web: The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
verses.ct: This is where the good news about Jesus Christ, the Son of God, begins.

verses.kjv: As it is written in the prophets, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
verses.web: As it is written in the prophets, “Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you:
verses.ct: As the prophets wrote long ago: "Look — I am sending my messenger ahead of you to prepare your way.

verses.kjv: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
verses.web: the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight!’ ”
verses.ct: A voice is calling out in the wilderness: 'Get the road ready for the Lord! Straighten out his paths!'"

verses.kjv: John did baptize in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
verses.web: John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching the baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins.
verses.ct: John appeared in the wilderness, baptizing people and preaching that they should repent and be baptized for the forgiveness of their sins.

verses.kjv: And there went out unto him all the land of Judaea, and they of Jerusalem, and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan, confessing their sins.
verses.web: All the country of Judea and all those of Jerusalem went out to him. They were baptized by him in the Jordan river, confessing their sins.
verses.ct: People from all across Judea and Jerusalem came out to see him. They confessed their sins and were baptized by him in the Jordan River.

verses.kjv: And John was clothed with camel’s hair, and with a girdle of a skin about his loins; and he did eat locusts and wild honey;
verses.web: John was clothed with camel’s hair and a leather belt around his waist. He ate locusts and wild honey.
verses.ct: John wore clothes made of camel's hair with a leather belt around his waist, and he lived on locusts and wild honey.

verses.kjv: And preached, saying, There cometh one mightier than I after me, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.
verses.web: He preached, saying, “After me comes he who is mightier than I, the thong of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen.
verses.ct: He preached to the crowds, saying, "Someone far more powerful than me is coming after me. I'm not even worthy to kneel down and untie his sandals.

verses.kjv: I indeed have baptized you with water: but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost.
verses.web: I baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.”
verses.ct: I've baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in Jordan.
verses.web: In those days, Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
verses.ct: During that time, Jesus traveled from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

verses.kjv: And straightway coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him:
verses.web: Immediately coming up from the water, he saw the heavens parting, and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
verses.ct: The moment he came up out of the water, he saw the heavens tear open and the Spirit coming down on him like a dove.

verses.kjv: And there came a voice from heaven, saying, Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
verses.web: A voice came out of the sky, “You are my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
verses.ct: Then a voice spoke from heaven: "You are my beloved Son, and I am deeply pleased with you."

verses.kjv: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness.
verses.web: Immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.
verses.ct: Right away, the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And he was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted of Satan; and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered unto him.
verses.web: He was there in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals; and the angels were serving him.
verses.ct: He stayed in the wilderness for 40 days, being tempted by Satan. Wild animals surrounded him, and angels took care of him.

verses.kjv: Now after that John was put in prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,
verses.web: Now after John was taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of God’s Kingdom,
verses.ct: After John was thrown in prison, Jesus went to Galilee and began preaching the good news of God's kingdom.

verses.kjv: And saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe the gospel.
verses.web: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and God’s Kingdom is at hand! Repent, and believe in the Good News.”
verses.ct: He said, "The time has come! God's kingdom is near. Repent and believe the good news."

verses.kjv: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
verses.web: Passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew, the brother of Simon, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
verses.ct: As Jesus walked along the shore of the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew throwing a net into the water — they were fishermen.

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto them, Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “Come after me, and I will make you into fishers for men.”
verses.ct: Jesus called out to them, "Come, follow me, and I'll make you fishers of men."

verses.kjv: And straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.
verses.web: Immediately they left their nets, and followed him.
verses.ct: They dropped their nets right then and followed him.

verses.kjv: And when he had gone a little farther thence, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the ship mending their nets.
verses.web: Going on a little further from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets.
verses.ct: A little farther down the shore, he saw James and John, the sons of Zebedee, sitting in their boat and mending their nets.

verses.kjv: And straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, and went after him.
verses.web: Immediately he called them, and they left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.
verses.ct: He called them immediately. They left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired workers and went with Jesus.

verses.kjv: And they went into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue, and taught.
verses.web: They went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.
verses.ct: They went to Capernaum, and on the Sabbath Jesus went straight into the synagogue and began teaching.

verses.kjv: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.
verses.web: They were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes.
verses.ct: The people were stunned by his teaching, because he spoke with real authority — nothing like the scribes.

verses.kjv: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,
verses.web: Immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,
verses.ct: Just then, a man in the synagogue who was possessed by an unclean spirit screamed out,

verses.kjv: Saying, Let us alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.
verses.web: saying, “Ha! What do we have to do with you, Jesus, you Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!”
verses.ct: "What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know exactly who you are — the Holy One of God!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.
verses.web: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!”
verses.ct: Jesus commanded the spirit sharply, "Be quiet and come out of him!"

verses.kjv: And when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him.
verses.web: The unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.
verses.ct: The unclean spirit threw the man into convulsions, let out a loud shriek, and came out of him.

verses.kjv: And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What thing is this? what new doctrine is this? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits, and they do obey him.
verses.web: They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, “What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”
verses.ct: Everyone was amazed. They turned to each other and said, "What is this? Some kind of new teaching? He gives orders to unclean spirits with authority, and they actually obey him!"

verses.kjv: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.
verses.web: The report of him went out immediately everywhere into all the region of Galilee and its surrounding area.
verses.ct: News about Jesus spread instantly across the entire region of Galilee.

verses.kjv: And forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
verses.web: Immediately, when they had come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
verses.ct: As soon as they left the synagogue, they went to the home of Simon and Andrew, along with James and John.

verses.kjv: But Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell him of her.
verses.web: Now Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told him about her.
verses.ct: Simon's mother-in-law was lying in bed with a fever, and they told Jesus about her right away.

verses.kjv: And he came and took her by the hand, and lifted her up; and immediately the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.
verses.web: He came and took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever left her immediately, and she served them.
verses.ct: He went to her, took her hand, and helped her up. The fever left her instantly, and she began serving them.

verses.kjv: And at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils.
verses.web: At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to him all who were sick, and those who were possessed by demons.
verses.ct: That evening after sunset, people brought to Jesus everyone who was sick or possessed by demons.

verses.kjv: And all the city was gathered together at the door.
verses.web: All the city was gathered together at the door.
verses.ct: The whole town crowded around the door.

verses.kjv: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases, and cast out many devils; and suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him.
verses.web: He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons. He didn’t allow the demons to speak, because they knew him.
verses.ct: He healed many people suffering from all kinds of diseases and drove out many demons. He wouldn't let the demons speak, because they knew who he was.

verses.kjv: And in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.
verses.web: Early in the morning, while it was still dark, he rose up and went out, and departed into a deserted place, and prayed there.
verses.ct: Long before dawn the next morning, Jesus got up, slipped away to a deserted place, and prayed.

verses.kjv: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him.
verses.web: Simon and those who were with him searched for him.
verses.ct: Simon and the others went searching for him.

verses.kjv: And when they had found him, they said unto him, All men seek for thee.
verses.web: They found him and told him, “Everyone is looking for you.”
verses.ct: When they found him, they said, "Everyone is looking for you!"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for therefore came I forth.
verses.web: He said to them, “Let’s go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because I came out for this reason.”
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Let's move on to the nearby towns so I can preach there too. That's why I came."

verses.kjv: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out devils.
verses.web: He went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out demons.
verses.ct: So he traveled throughout all of Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.

verses.kjv: And there came a leper to him, beseeching him, and kneeling down to him, and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
verses.web: A leper came to him, begging him, kneeling down to him, and saying to him, “If you want to, you can make me clean.”
verses.ct: A man with leprosy came to him, dropped to his knees, and begged, "If you're willing, you can make me clean."

verses.kjv: And Jesus, moved with compassion, put forth his hand, and touched him, and saith unto him, I will; be thou clean.
verses.web: Being moved with compassion, he stretched out his hand, and touched him, and said to him, “I want to. Be made clean.”
verses.ct: Filled with compassion, Jesus reached out his hand and touched him. "I am willing," he said. "Be clean."

verses.kjv: And as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed.
verses.web: When he had said this, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was made clean.
verses.ct: The instant Jesus spoke, the leprosy vanished and the man was completely healed.

verses.kjv: And he straitly charged him, and forthwith sent him away;
verses.web: He strictly warned him, and immediately sent him out,
verses.ct: Jesus gave him a stern warning and sent him away at once.

verses.kjv: And saith unto him, See thou say nothing to any man: but go thy way, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
verses.web: and said to him, “See you say nothing to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”
verses.ct: He told him, "Don't say a word about this to anyone. Go straight to the priest, show yourself to him, and make the offering that Moses required for your cleansing — so it serves as proof to everyone."

verses.kjv: But he went out, and began to publish it much, and to blaze abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.
verses.web: But he went out, and began to proclaim it much, and to spread about the matter, so that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was outside in desert places. People came to him from everywhere.
verses.ct: But the man went out and told everyone he could, spreading the news so widely that Jesus could no longer enter any town openly. He had to stay out in remote areas — and still people came to him from everywhere.
